summary.text: Provides for: (1) an adjournment of the House of Representatives on any legislative day from November 21 through 28, 2003, until December 2, 2003, and an adjournment sine die from December 2, 2003, through the remainder of the first session of the 108th Congress; and (2) a recess or an adjournment of the Senate on any day from November 21 through 28, 2003, until December 2, 2003, and an adjournment sine die from December 2, 2003, through the remainder of the first session of the 108th Congress.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Provides for: (1) an adjournment of the House of Representatives on any legislative day from November 21 through 28, 2003, until December 2, 2003, and an adjournment sine die from December 2, 2003, through the remainder of the first session of the 108th Congress; and (2) a recess or an adjournment of the Senate on any day from November 21 through 28, 2003, until December 2, 2003, and an adjournment sine die from December 2, 2003, through the remainder of the first session of the 108th Congress.

Provides that when the House of Representatives adjourns on any legislative day from November 25, 2003, and the Senate recesses or adjourns at the close of business on any day from November 24, 2003, through the remainder of the first session of the 108th Congress, they stand adjourned sine die, or stand recessed or adjourned until such day and time as may be specified by the respective Majority Leader or his designee.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
